At-a-Glance: Set clear, seasonal thresholds so actions are timely and consistent across the team.
Objectives: Define trigger bands for growth, harvest, and winter prep.
Tie thresholds to specific products and methods.
What Good Looks Like: One sheet with per-100 and drop thresholds by month.
Green-amber-red action bands posted in the truck.
Step-by-Step: 1) Choose default sampling method and units.
2) Agree seasonal triggers for each yard profile.
3) Map actions to triggers with products and constraints.
4) Review outcomes and tweak bands annually.
Seasonality & Climate: Brood cycles shift thresholds; heat limits some products.
Data & Thresholds: Per-100 adult bee targets and daily drop ranges.
Diagnostics & Decision Tree: Trigger hit during heat wave -> Switch to permitted option or delay safely.
Counts rebound fast -> Re-infestation; re-check neighbours and drift.
Tools & Techniques: Simple dashboard from scale and sampling logs.
Safety & Compliance: Follow label, withdrawal, and local rules.
Communications: Explain why bands differ pre- vs post-harvest.
Notes: Date every threshold sheet and archive versions so changes are traceable.
